content: this is dmg and we're making barrels okay so we're entering the wonderful
world of barrels so what you're going to have to do is find a thick cardboard
tube that's probably going to be about one and a half inches wide or one inch
wide and the idea is that it's thick because it will help the strengthen the
barrel itself once we're doing it so I'm just measuring out four centimeters it's
a little short of an inch and I'm just going to mark it go around and mark the
market tube at four centimeter intervals and then just connect all the dots
together so at least we have a point to cut from now these sort of tubes you'll
find in heavy-duty aluminium foil aluminum foil in America also known as
tin foil and I use scissors just to clean up any debris that may be on the
end from previous barrels like the prototype and then I just use a craft
knife to pierce and cut through now obviously important that you are pushing
away from yourself and not pushing towards yourself and you have some sort
of cardboard or something underneath it you're not going to stab the table or
yourself in the process so again just grab some scissors and
clean off any excess bits and pieces from the cutting and now we're going to
measure in one centimeter from each edge and make a mark and continue that right
around the tube again and so that we have a point where we're going to start
to curve the barrel this is why barrels have always been very difficult because
they are curved in shape I did a giant vat as one of my projects and you may
have seen pictures of that on my website and that actually was using lollipop
sticks but they were curved which is difficult to achieve and I made
video on that letter that gives you the secret us how that would have been done
but anyway we're continuing on with drawing a line around and on both sides
and now we're just measuring about a half centimeter or third of centimeter
lines going around on each side and eventually I just decided to connect
them straight through and that'll give you a guide as to you know where the
planks are on the on the barrel now we're only going to use cardboard in
this we're not actually going to use lollipop sticks it would be very very
difficult this size and the scale to actually achieve this with lollipop
sticks or matchsticks and what I'm doing here with the scissors I'm just cutting
that up to that one centimeter line on each little line of created so you're
cutting in I'm just using boots of speed because it does salute you know there
are a lot of them and I'm just cutting up to that one centimeter line all the
way around for every single line there okay now what I'm doing is I'm slicing
off a half triangle on each side of those teeth that are there and so that
they it's a V pointing towards the inside of the barrel so so if you if it
was a V it would be pointing towards the inside of the barrel so I'm cutting each
tooth on each side with half a V so that you essentially have those V gaps on em
each side and so this is when we actually bend everything they'll come
back together again and give us this curved look so be sure to clean out all
the little bits of excess cardboard it is quite finicky and this is where
having a good strong tube is important because it will be
quite durable and once this is finished so again we just keep cutting those V's
in there are a lot of them you've got to do so this is a more painstaking process
but because barrels are traditionally very difficult to do it is well worth it
it's rewarding to have something needs at the
end so now what we're doing is we're going to be pushing in those teeth okay
as I just on each side push them in so that close together and that's what's
giving you the curve look now if it's very tough you can just roll it to force
it in towards itself so there we've got the basic shape so now we're going to
have to create the extra bits so I'm just tracing around the base of the
barrel that's been pushed in I'm going to make it easier to see there cut out
the circle this is just on cardstock and then trace that circle again on
cardstock and then cut that out again and that's basically going to be forming
the lids now if you want to open barrel you only create one of these lids and
then you can put stuff inside the barrel like little beads to show that apples or
fruit or something or you can just fill it up halfway and put some sort of
liquid in there or make it look like water ropes of something whatever you
like but I'm doing a closed one at the moment so what I'm doing is just testing
to see I've pushed the cardboard in from the other side and I'm just testing to
see how wide it is if it's going to fit and it's not so I'm just going to trim
it down a little bit taking off probably about one millimeter
around the edge now if yours fits straight out then you
don't need to do this but if they don't take them out and cut them up so those
are the two - the top and bottom and of the of the barrel and now I'm measuring
one and a half centimeters I measured the barrel between those two lines as
two centimeters so I'm creating one and a half centimeters strip here and that's
going to save space for the banding now these are going to be the wooden struts
on on the inside of the barrel sorry on the outer edge of the barrel and I'm
just measuring and those are half centimeter strips again I
really cut them out with scissors now this is just regular cardstock it could
be any kind of box cereal box anything it doesn't really matter and so just cut
those strips out of just using boots of speed to speed this up and then you get
some hot glue put it on the inside of the curve so important that it's on the
inside of the curve and then stick the lid in from the other side and push it
up into the hot glue you will see a lot of wisps and then on the other one just
put it onto the lid itself first and be careful that quite brute is hot so this
is quite delicate this is the difficult part of having a closed one and then
we're going to place that inside now this is quite difficult you I just used
a little piece of this card stock and and push it in through those teeth the
slats to just get the lid back up to the top and that's probably the most
difficult thing in this is to have that lid closed obviously with an open one
you wouldn't need to do that process so I'm just adding some extra glue on the
top just to make that's more stable and now I'm placing glue down and the sides
for about one and a half centimeters and I'll just do about three at a time then
glue those cardboard strips on and continue that process right around the
barrel so this gives the illusion of the barrel bulging out somewhat and we then
we're going to do some banding as well so I've just a thousand League boosts
ahead here just to put on the final strips of cardboard and DAP
this so that forms all the wooden slats in the outside inside edge and now what
I'm doing is I'm just cutting off a two millimeter and
strip from the cardstock I'm just going to cut two of those and make them longer
than what you're going to need and these are going to be forming the banding make
it longer and then what you do is you just hold it down run in and wrap it
around and then bend it back when you've got it to where you need it to be and
once that's bent back then you can grab the scissors and cut it off and then
measure the other one and cut those as the same time so that the same length
okay then just play some hot glue around there at the top of those inside slats
and roll the card stock around make sure you've got the blank card stock you
don't have any printed matter or anything because be more difficult to
paint that way so again just hot glue around hold down the card stock and just
wrap it right around obviously with this you're probably going to get some wisps
and be careful the hot glue is hot all right so this is just a mini just to
show you how a mini can stand on there let's grab another one so it's great
terrain for all kinds of complex battles so what I'm going to do here is mix some
yellow and brown and a bit of black and I've base painted that just as you would
have done in video three same as the tiles just with black spray-paint and
now I'm just mixing in loosely mixing in the yellow brown and black and this
forms a sort of dark green sort of color for a sort of aged rotten wood sort of
look and I'm just going to use boots of speed to go ahead here and go to work
everything except the banding and be quite thorough with this but don't get
into the into the grooves it's fine of the black to shove it through there it
will give it some dimension so I'm just then going over to gain with a bit more
yellow in it and finally I'm going to use some white so
the idea with adding the white here is to give it somewhat of the would look
obviously because this is not wood I'm just going to use streaks of white to
achieve that sort of would look as I would have done with dry brushing in the
wooden door video and also in the tables and chairs videos and the bookcase video
as well so I'm just boot to speeding ahead here and just make sure I'm
getting every single slat and you can pay attention to more detail on here as
well and I already go to town because this is a nice little piece and it
starts to look quite good and finally we're going to have to do the banding so
now the banding because I use a limited color you could use some bronze if
you've got any bronze in your color palette but because I'm only using very
limited colors I'm going to apply white but not just solid white I'm just going
to sort of slowly allow the black and everything to come through so be quite
gray and it doesn't matter if some of the greeny muck wood colour shines
through as well this is just to get the effect of the banding around the barrel
itself so if you've got many paints or something you've got some bronze you can
always just use a bronze for that it'll also look pretty good but this you
know if you can't afford to run out and buy large pots of paint for lots of
money so I've just painted some red X's on there as for red X's to signify from
the Forex planet and this is what it looks like on on the table and you'll
see some of these minis and how they get made later on in the series so that's
how we make barrels hopefully that easy because barrels has always been very
very difficult now if you want to find out other things I've been up to you can
